verses.verse: And the Lord <WH3068> spoke <WH1696> unto Moses <WH4872>, saying <WH559>,

Speak <WH1696> unto Aaron <WH175> and to his sons <WH1121>, that they separate <WH5144> themselves from the holy things <WH6944> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>, and that they profane <WH2490> not my holy <WH6944> name <WH8034> in those things which they hallow <WH6942> unto me <WH3068>: I am the Lord.

Say <WH559> unto them <WH376>, Whoever he be of all your seed <WH2233> among your generations <WH1755>, that goes <WH7126> unto the holy things <WH6944>, which the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> hallow <WH6942> unto the Lord <WH3068>, having his uncleanness <WH2932> upon him <WH5315>, that soul shall be cut off <WH3772> from my presence <WH6440>: I am the Lord <WH3068>.

Whatever man who is <WH376> of the seed <WH2233> of Aaron <WH175> is a leper <WH6879>, or has a running issue <WH2100>; he shall not eat <WH398> of the holy things <WH6944>, until he be clean <WH2891>. And whoever touches <WH5060> any thing that is unclean <WH2931> by the dead <WH5315>, or a man <WH376> whose seed <WH2233> goes from him <WH3318>;

Or whoever <WH376> touches <WH5060> any creeping thing <WH8318>, by which he may be made unclean <WH2930>, or a man <WH120> of whom he may take uncleanness <WH2930>, whatever uncleanness he has <WH2932>

The soul <WH5315> which has touched <WH5060> any such shall be unclean <WH2930> until evening <WH6153>, and shall not eat <WH398> of the holy things <WH6944>, unless <WH518> he wash <WH7364> his flesh <WH1320> with water <WH4325>.
And when the sun <WH8121> is down <WH935>, he shall be clean <WH2891>, and shall afterward <WH310> eat <WH398> of the holy things <WH6944>; because it is his food <WH3899>.
That which dies of itself <WH5038>, or is torn <WH2966> with animals <WH398>, he shall not eat to defile <WH2930> himself with it I am the Lord <WH3068>.

They shall therefore keep <WH8104> my ordinance <WH4931>, lest they carry <WH5375> sin <WH2399> for it <WH4191>, and die therefore <WH2490>, if they profane it <WH3068>: I the Lord do sanctify them <WH6942>.

There shall no stranger <WH2114> eat <WH398> of the holy thing <WH6944>: a stranger staying <WH8453> with the priest <WH3548>, or a hired servant <WH7916>, shall not eat <WH398> of the holy thing <WH6944>.

But if the priest <WH3548> buy <WH7069> any soul <WH5315> with <WH7075> his money <WH3701>, he shall eat <WH398> of it <WH3211>, and he that is born in his house <WH1004>: they shall eat <WH398> of his food <WH3899>.
If the priest <WH3548>'s daughter <WH1323> also be married unto a stranger <WH376>, she may not eat <WH398> of an offering <WH8641> of the holy things <WH6944>.

But if the priest <WH3548>'s daughter <WH1323> be a widow <WH490>, or divorced <WH1644>, and have no child <WH2233>, and is returned <WH7725> unto her father <WH1>'s house <WH1004>, as in her youth <WH5271>, she shall eat <WH398> of her father <WH1>'s food <WH3899>: but there shall no stranger <WH2114> eat there <WH398>.

And if a man <WH376> eat <WH398> of the holy thing <WH6944> unwittingly <WH7684>, then he shall put <WH3254> the fifth <WH2549> part there unto it <WH5414>, and shall give it unto the priest <WH3548> with the holy thing <WH6944>.
And they shall not profane <WH2490> the holy things <WH6944> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>, which they offer <WH7311> unto the Lord <WH3068>;
Or allow them to carry <WH5375> the iniquity <WH5771> of trespass <WH819>, when they eat <WH398> their holy things <WH6944>: for I the Lord <WH3068> do sanctify them <WH6942>.
And the Lord <WH3068> spoke <WH1696> unto Moses <WH4872>, saying <WH559>,

Speak <WH1696> unto Aaron <WH175>, and to his sons <WH1121>, and unto all the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>, and say <WH559> unto them <WH376>, Whatever he be of the house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478>, or of the strangers <WH1616> in Israel <WH3478>, that will offer <WH7126> his oblation <WH7133> for all his vows <WH5088>, and for all his freewill offerings <WH5071>, which they will offer <WH7126> unto the Lord <WH3068> for a burnt offering <WH5930>;
You shall offer at your own will <WH7522> a male <WH2145> outside blemish <WH8549>, of the bulls <WH1241>, of the sheep <WH3775>, or of the goats <WH5795>.
But whatever has a blemish <WH3971>, that shall you not offer <WH7126>: for it shall not be acceptable for you <WH7522>.

And whoever <WH376> offers <WH7126> a sacrifice <WH2077> of peace offerings <WH8002> unto the Lord <WH3068> to accomplish <WH6381> his vow <WH5088>, or a freewill offering <WH5071> in bulls <WH1241> or sheep <WH6629>, it shall be perfect <WH8549> to be accepted <WH7522>; there shall be no blemish in it <WH3971>.

Blind <WH5788>, or broken <WH7665>, or crippled <WH2782>, or having a running sore <WH2990>, or scurvy <WH1618>, or scabbed <WH3217>, you shall not offer <WH7126> these unto the Lord <WH3068>, nor make <WH5414> an offering by fire <WH801> of them upon the altar <WH4196> unto the Lord <WH3068>.

Either a bullock <WH7794> or a lamb <WH7716> that has any thing deformed <WH8311> or lacking in his parts <WH7038>, that may you offer <WH6213> for a freewill offering <WH5071>; but for a vow <WH5088> it shall not be accepted <WH7521>.

You shall not offer <WH7126> unto the Lord <WH3068> that which is bruised <WH4600>, or crushed <WH3807>, or broken <WH5423>, or cut <WH3772>; neither shall you make <WH6213> any offering there in your land <WH776>.

Neither from a stranger <WH5236>'s hand <WH3027> shall you offer <WH7126> the bread <WH3899> of your God <WH430> of any of these <WH4893>; because their corruption is in them <WH3971>, and blemishes be in them <WH7521>: they shall not be accepted for you.
And the Lord <WH3068> spoke <WH1696> unto Moses <WH4872>, saying <WH559>,

When a bullock <WH7794>, or a sheep <WH3775>, or a goat <WH5795>, is brought forth <WH3205>, then it shall be seven <WH7651> days <WH3117> under the mother <WH517>; and from the eighth <WH8066> day <WH3117> and thenceforth <WH1973> it shall be accepted <WH7521> for an offering <WH7133> made by fire <WH801> unto the Lord <WH3068>.
And whether it be cow <WH7794> or ewe <WH7716>, you shall not kill <WH7819> it and her young <WH1121> both in one <WH259> day <WH3117>.
And when you will offer <WH2076> a sacrifice <WH2077> of thanksgiving <WH8426> unto the Lord <WH3068>, offer <WH2076> it at your own will <WH7522>.
On the same day <WH3117> it shall be eaten up <WH398>; you shall leave <WH3498> none of it until the next day <WH1242>: I am the Lord <WH3068>.
Therefore shall you keep <WH8104> my commandments <WH4687>, and do <WH6213> them <WH3068>: I am the Lord.

Neither shall you profane <WH2490> my holy <WH6944> name <WH8034>; but I will be hallowed <WH6942> among <WH8432> the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>: I am the Lord <WH3068> which hallow you <WH6942>,
That brought you out <WH3318> of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, to be your God <WH430>: I am the Lord <WH3068>.
